title: East Leeds Orbital Route – Finishing Works
description: Final landscaping, active‑travel links and smart‑traffic systems on the new dual‑carriageway orbital route connecting the A6120 to J46 of the M1.
statusRationale: Major civils complete; snagging and landscaping underway for hand‑over in late 2024.

title: Armley Gyratory Remodelling – Phase 2
description: Replacement of footbridges, new segregated cycleways and final carriageway widening at the key junction west of Leeds city centre.
statusRationale: Bridge fabrication delays have pushed programme by four months.

title: Leeds City Square Gateway
description: Pedestrianisation and public‑realm transformation outside Leeds railway station, removing through‑traffic and creating event space and greenery.
statusRationale: Surfacing and planting continue; completion due autumn 2024 ahead of Year of Culture activities.

title: White Rose Rail Station (Leeds)
description: New two‑platform rail station on the Leeds–Huddersfield line serving the White Rose business park and the Elland Road corridor.
statusRationale: Platform installation on programme; overhead line work coordination poses schedule risk.

title: Leeds Bradford Airport Parkway Station
description: Parkway rail station and 350‑space park‑and‑ride to improve public‑transport connections to Leeds Bradford Airport.
statusRationale: Funding gap following Network Rail cost review; alternative options being explored.

title: Aire Park Regeneration – Phase 1
description: Delivery of new public parkland, offices and 1,100 homes on the former Tetley Brewery South Bank site.
statusRationale: Ground remediation complete; vertical build due to start Q1 2025 subject to market conditions.

title: South Bank Viaduct Active‑Travel Greenway
description: Conversion of the redundant Holbeck Viaduct into an elevated walking and cycling route linking the South Bank to Elland Road.
statusRationale: Concept design funded; full scheme dependent on securing Levelling‑Up resources.

title: Leeds PIPES District Heating Network – Phase 2
description: Extension of the Leeds PIPES low‑carbon heat network to the South Bank and through‑routing across the city centre.
statusRationale: Pipe‑laying works running ahead of schedule with minimal traffic disruption.

title: Leeds CityBike Docked Hire Scheme
description: Roll‑out of 630 e‑bikes across 140 docking stations serving inner‑ring neighbourhoods and university campuses.
statusRationale: Supplier appointed; first 50 docks operational since May 2024.

title: Bus & HGV Retrofit – Leeds Clean Air Programme
description: Retrofit of 400 buses and 600 HGVs with Euro VI technology to reduce NOx emissions following cancellation of the charging CAZ.
statusRationale: 75 % of eligible fleet now upgraded; final tranche scheduled winter 2024/25.

title: Elland New Rail Station
description: Two‑platform station on the Calder Valley Line with pedestrian links to Elland town centre and Park Road.
statusRationale: Design approval stage; full business case submission planned mid‑2025.

evidence.title: Elland Rail Station project takes another step forward
evidence.summary: Progress on the new Elland Rail Station has taken a major step forward after a contractor was appointed to finalize the project’s detailed design. On-site surveys are underway and a full business case will follow by mid-2025, paving the way for final approval and the start of construction.

evidence.title: Elland Rail Station Moves Forward: West Yorkshire’s £25m Transport Boost on Track
evidence.summary: Plans for the new £25 million Elland Rail Station are making significant progress, with completion now projected for late 2026. Contractor Keltbray is aiming to finish the final design stage by summer 2024, after which the West Yorkshire Combined Authority will review the full business case to move the project into the construction phase.

evidence.title: New train station moves a step closer
evidence.summary: A contractor has been appointed to oversee the final development stages of Elland’s new railway station, which will be added to the Calder Valley Line and is now expected to open in 2026. Keltbray Infrastructure Services will complete detailed design work by next summer, after which the project can proceed to final approval and then construction, according to local officials.

title: A641 Bradford–Brighouse–Huddersfield Corridor Programme
description: Series of junction upgrades, bus‑priority and active‑travel measures along the A641 cross‑boundary strategic route.
statusRationale: Outline business case approved; phased construction to follow between 2026‑30.

title: Brighouse Town Deal – Canalside & Market Hub
description: Redevelopment of Brighouse Open Market and creation of new public spaces on the canalside and Thornton Square.
statusRationale: Main works started; market relocation underway; completion expected late 2025.

evidence.title: On the move – Brighouse’s market prepares for temporary home
evidence.summary: Brighouse Open Market is relocating to a temporary site this autumn so that work can begin on constructing its new permanent market hall on the canalside as part of the £19.1 million Town Deal. After planning permission was secured in March 2024, Triton Construction was appointed as contractor for the market redevelopment, with the main construction phase set to start by late September 2024 and last around 12 months.

evidence.title: Milestone moment for Brighouse as Town Deal market transformation begins
evidence.summary: By late 2024, construction was underway on Brighouse’s Town Deal projects to revitalize the waterfront and market area. Demolition of the old canalside market building began in October, and West Yorkshire-based Triton Construction has been tasked with building the new covered market hall as a focal point for the town’s regeneration.

evidence.title: Brighouse Town Deal: Progress made on £19.1 million Government-funded projects in 2024 including Brighouse Market
evidence.summary: According to a year-end 2024 update, Brighouse’s Town Deal scheme has reached key milestones in both the market and public realm projects. The old market site was cleared and construction of a modern market hall (with 21 fixed stalls and improved facilities) is in progress, on track for completion in late 2025. Meanwhile, £6 million of the Town Deal is dedicated to Canalside and Thornton Square improvements – creating a new waterfront public space and enhancing the town centre’s image to encourage recreation and community gatherings.

title: Hebden Bridge Flood Alleviation Scheme
description: Combination of walls, raised footpaths and movable weirs along the Hebden Water and River Calder.
statusRationale: Ground‑investigation results delayed; revised programme under review.

title: Todmorden Learning Centre & Enterprise Hub Phase 2
description: Low‑carbon retrofit of a Grade II‑listed former college to create co‑working and skills spaces focused on green technologies.
statusRationale: Fabric upgrade package 80 % complete; fit‑out to follow.

title: Calderdale Full‑Fibre Spine Extension
description: installation of 38 km of gigabit fibre spine linking council assets and rural communities.
statusRationale: Civil trenching 95 % complete; testing and commissioning scheduled November 2024.

title: Calderdale Active‑Travel Package 2024‑26
description: Delivery of 23 km of segregated cycle routes connecting Sowerby Bridge, Halifax and Brighouse.
statusRationale: Utility diversions causing localised delays.

title: Dewsbury Market Redevelopment
description: Comprehensive rebuild and re‑roofing of the Grade II‑listed open market, creating food hall, stalls and events space.
statusRationale: Cost inflation risk being managed through value‑engineering.

title: Dewsbury Blueprint – Station Gateway
description: Public‑realm and transport interchange improvements linking Dewsbury rail station to the town centre arcade.
statusRationale: Main works contract awarded April 2024; construction mobilised.

title: Ravensthorpe Station Relocation & Grade‑Separation
description: Building a new station 300 m east and grade‑separating lines to enable faster Transpennine services.
statusRationale: Network Rail main works now let; enabling works progressing.

title: Spen Valley Leisure Centre Renewable Retrofit
description: Installation of ground‑source heat pumps and solar PV to achieve net‑zero operation at the new leisure centre in Liversedge.
statusRationale: Drilling works underway; system commissioning due March 2025.

title: A629 Corridor – Phase 4 Ainley Top & Ainley Bridge
description: Reconfiguration of Ainley Top roundabout and dedicated bus‑only link towards Halifax to remove bottlenecks.
statusRationale: Consultation launched January 2025; business case in development.

title: Holmfirth Town Centre Access Scheme
description: Highway realignment, new bridge and riverside walkway to reduce congestion and enhance public space in Holmfirth.
statusRationale: Funding confirmed via Levelling Up Fund Round 2; detailed design ongoing.

title: Huddersfield Southern Gateway (A62 Smart Corridor)
description: Intelligent traffic‑management, bus‑priority and cycle superhighway on the A62 Leeds Road into Huddersfield.
statusRationale: Signal‑equipment shortages causing procurement delays.

evidence.title: On the right track: A62 Leeds Road Smart Corridor making progress and tipped to deliver on time
evidence.summary: Kirklees Council reported that construction on the A62 Leeds Road “Smart Corridor” was progressing well in late 2022, with the main works on track to be completed by spring 2023. The scheme – part of West Yorkshire’s Corridor Improvement Programme – is designed to cut congestion and improve journey times with new bus lanes, cycle facilities and junction upgrades along the route.

evidence.title: Brand new £8m Yorkshire road dug up weeks later due to gas leak
evidence.summary: The £7.9 million A62 Leeds Road Smart Corridor scheme in Huddersfield reached completion in mid-April 2023, delivering major highway upgrades to tackle congestion and improve travel times and safety on this key route. (The project’s final resurfacing was finished in April, slightly later than originally planned due to earlier schedule adjustments and supply challenges.)

evidence.title: Updates to schedule of upcoming A62 improvements will mean less disruption for residents and businesses
evidence.summary: In 2022, the council revised the construction schedule for the A62 Smart Corridor project to accelerate works and reduce disruption. An intensified seven-week closure at a key junction was implemented so that overall roadworks could finish by early December 2022 – about two months sooner than originally planned. (Subsequent updates indicated the project’s final completion date slipped into spring 2023, partly due to challenges in obtaining new traffic signal equipment.)

title: Penistone Line Upgrade (Huddersfield‑Sheffield)
description: Track, signalling and station improvements to enable half‑hourly services and increase line‑speed.
statusRationale: Awaiting DfT decision on Restoring Your Railway funding.

title: Kirklees Municipal Full‑Fibre Roll‑Out
description: Connection of 210 public‑sector sites to gigabit‑capable fibre as part of the DCMS LFFN programme.
statusRationale: Final splicing works underway; project tracking under budget.

title: CityConnect Cycle Superhighway – Phase 4 A660
description: Extension of segregated cycleway from Headingley to Adel along the A660, linking university campuses to outer suburbs.
statusRationale: Utilities surveys complete; construction starts January 2025.

title: Otley Road Bus Priority & Landscape Scheme
description: Inbound bus lane, upgraded crossings and tree‑line boulevard on A660 from Lawnswood to Weetwood Lane.
statusRationale: Major civils substantially complete; snagging in progress.

title: City Park Affordable Housing Phase 1
description: Construction of 350 affordable apartments adjacent to the new City Park in South Bank.
statusRationale: Contractor procurement ongoing; start on site expected late 2024.

evidence.title: Aire Park Leeds: Housing developer found for “prime plot” on Meadow Lane in the city centre
evidence.summary: Leeds City Council has chosen developer Glenbrook as the preferred bidder for a prime 0.18-hectare plot at Meadow Lane, adjacent to the new City Park (Aire Park) in the South Bank. Glenbrook is expected to seek planning permission to deliver a high-quality residential development of around 350 apartments on the site, with a significant proportion of the homes designated as affordable housing.

evidence.title: £50m secured for Leeds South Bank apartment scheme
evidence.summary: A major housing development in Leeds’s South Bank has secured a £50 million loan from Homes England, enabling construction of 375 apartments across two towers on Water Lane. The project, which also received £4.4 million from West Yorkshire’s Brownfield Housing Fund, commenced building work in May 2024 and is scheduled to complete by early 2027. The scheme supports regional goals for affordable, sustainable homes on brownfield land through a partnership of public and private investment.

title: Brownlee Centre Cycling Circuit Expansion
description: 1 km extension and lighting of the closed‑road cycle circuit at Bodington Playing Fields.
statusRationale: Planning permission granted February 2024; construction underway.

title: East Leeds Orbital Active‑Travel Spine
description: 12 km off‑highway greenway running parallel to ELOR linking new housing sites to cycle network.
statusRationale: Land assembly negotiations ongoing with developers.

title: Leeds Zero‑Carbon School Pilot (3 Sites)

statusRationale: First site underway; lesson‑learnt feedback integrated into next two tenders.

title: City Varieties Theatre Heritage Refurbishment

statusRationale: Works progressing during summer dark period; reopening booked for November 2024.

title: Royal Armouries Museum Expansion & Quay Link

statusRationale: Design competition launched; funding package to be finalised.

title: Calderdale Royal Hospital Redevelopment – Elective Hub

statusRationale: Awaiting confirmation of New Hospitals Programme funding slot.

title: Carbon‑Negative Highways Depot (Elland)

statusRationale: Steel frame erected; photovoltaics delivery scheduled July 2024.

title: Kirklees Passivhaus Housing Programme Phase 1
description: Delivery of 180 council homes built to Passivhaus standard across eight brownfield sites.
statusRationale: Planning approvals secured on first three plots; contractor framework in place.

title: Kirklees School Streets Phase 2

statusRationale: Signage and ANPR installation ongoing; launch scheduled September 2024 term.

title: Kirklees Energy‑from‑Waste Plant Life‑Extension

statusRationale: Boiler outage extended due to supply‑chain delays.
